availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Simon E. Higgins (Crab Orchard, Kentucky, merchant and justice of the peace)

body.p: Crab Orchard, Kentucky, merchant and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Jane C. Higgins. Father of John S. Higgins, Catherine E. Higgins, Mary Susan Higgins, Jeremiah F. Higgins, Margaret Higgins, Calista Higgins, Jane Higgins, S. E. Higgins, and Ephraim P. Higgins. Merchant in Crab Orchard in 1860. Justice of the peace in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Crab Orchard, p. 54; Find A Grave, "Simon E. Higgins (1818-1889)," Memorial #XXXXXXXX, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=66965643&ref=acom (accessed May 30, 2017).
